metadata.synopsis: Jaheira is reunited with her family, who thought her missing out in the shadowlands. Her eldest daughter Rion takes the lead, quizzing Jaheira on how she got back to the city and her silence since then.
metadata.how_to_trigger: - Go into Jaheira's house with Jaheira- Be spotted by the daughter (Half elf adult girl in the house)

25.speaker: Jaheira
25.text: Oh, Malar's mark. Here we go.
25.context: CinematicNodeContext: We enter the hallway to find the little girl has run to a young half-elf and half-orc. They listen to her a moment, then stand to glare at the party; specifically, JAHEIRA. InternalNodeContext: The granddaughter has spotted Jaheira and reported she's coming, ahead of time.

40.speaker: Rion
40.text: Are we quite sure she hasn't actually died this time, brother? She looks dead.
40.context: NodeContext: Mock curiousity - speaking to her brother as if Jaheira isn't there. Looking her up and down and not impressed with what she sees.

31.speaker: Jord
31.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking at Jaheira, speaking to Rion

37.speaker: Jaheira
37.text: It has been a hard road. But I can clip you both around the ear to prove I am no ghost, if it would help?

35.speaker: Rion
35.text: Forgive us, mother. We're just surprised you still know how to find your way home.
35.context: NodeContext: Shrugging, snarky - 'you can hardly blame us for being confused'.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: She wasn't exactly willing. I think she'd rather go back to the shadow-curse.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: Mother? Jaheira, these are your children?

46.speaker: Rion
46.text: She always brings the smartest people home, too.
46.context: NodeContext: Snort, mocking (not mean, just unimpressed)

19.speaker: Jaheira
19.text: Enough, Rion. I taught you better manners than that.

29.speaker: Minsc
29.text: Some battles, even Boo is not brave enough to fight.
29.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shaking his head, urging us not to get involved.

48.speaker: Rion
48.text: A Sending spell can carry twenty-five words. Do you know how many Jaheira's only message contained, in all this time she's been away? Seven.
48.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ignoring Jaheira, to playerNodeContext: Bluntly steam-rolling over Jaheira, speaking directly to player: 'did you hear what this shit-head did?'

39.speaker: Player
39.text: This really isn't any of my business.

24.speaker: Rion
24.text: Hah - now there is a phrase Jaheira has never uttered. But no.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: 'Met. Gorgeous. Hero. Out. In. Shadow-Lands.' Is 'shadow-lands' one word or two?

0.speaker: Jaheira
0.text: The cleric who cast the Sending was wounded. Should I have sobbed on her shoulder?

17.speaker: Rion
17.text: The message went: 'I'm sorry. You know what to do.'
17.context: CinematicNodeContext: turning back to Jaheira accusinglyNodeContext: turning back to Jaheira, deadpan and unimpressed

41.speaker: Jaheira
41.text: So why haven't you done it? You were supposed to get the young ones out of the city.

6.speaker: Rion
6.text: And you were supposed to be dead. That's what your oh-so-stoic message meant, yes?
6.context: NodeContext: 'So what?' Not to be diverted by Jaheira's excuses

20.speaker: Rion
20.text: Yet here you are. So - what happened out there?

15.speaker: Jaheira
15.text: I got my skin saved by this one. We've come to take the fight to the cult - which is exactly why you all cannot be here.

27.speaker: Rion
27.text: Why? You plan on winning, don't you?
27.context: NodeContext: Brushing off Jaheira's warnings about the coming danger

38.speaker: Rion
38.text: You're the one who saved her, so tell me - are we all doomed?

16.speaker: Rion
16.context: NodeContext: Back to Jaheira: 'You should be more like this one'

26.speaker: Player
26.text: The cult is powerful - it's not going to be an easy fight.

22.speaker: Rion
22.text: So fight. That's what all you heroes and Harpers are for, isn't it?
22.context: NodeContext: Shrug - there's a job to be done, so do it

28.speaker: Player
28.text: You should really just listen to your mother.

44.speaker: Rion
44.text: Ugh. The one stern parent is quite enough, thank you very much.

14.speaker: Rion
14.text: Fine. Better in our home than quivering in some bush out in the Cloakwood.

10.speaker: Jaheira
10.text: You are a very irritating girl.

13.speaker: Rion
13.text: Ah-ah. This isn't your house, remember? You'll keep a civil tongue under our roof, if we let you stay at all.
13.context: NodeContext: Chiding. Not serious about not letting Jaheira stay, but forcing her to go through the motions of being judged anyway

43.speaker: Jord
43.text: Have mercy, sister. She's old, after all.

5.speaker: Jhessem
5.context: NodeContext: Chiming up, enjoying this bullying of Jaheira

23.speaker: Fig
23.text: She can stay - but only if she brought home presents.

18.speaker: Rion
18.text: Seems I'm out-voted. See, mother - that is how you go about talking things through with your family.
18.context: NodeContext: Sighing, relenting - but getting one last pointed dig in at Jaheira.

4.speaker: Rion
4.text: Now if there's more to discuss, then bloody well come in. And wipe your boots.
4.context: NodeContext: Moving on from the conflict immediately - she has better things to do.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: When surrounded by the enemy, every word counts. Be grateful she sent anything at all.

9.speaker: Jaheira
9.text: If you are trying to help me, please stop.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: This is a beautiful home. I figured Jaheira lived in a cave. Alone.

42.speaker: Rion
42.text: You know mother dear well already.

50.speaker: Rion
50.context: InternalNodeContext: The branch where the granddaughter hasn't been alerted and told them Jaheira is comingNodeContext: Deadpan, sarcastic - your mother Jaheira has finally deigned to turn up at your home
